summary: West Africa experienced the largest Ebola outbreak in the history of the virus, resulting in more than 11,000 deaths as of June 2016. In response to the outbreak, the U.S. Agency for International Development began funding a range of activities to control the virus's spread and strengthen global health security. Congress later provided billions of dollars to support and reimburse these efforts, and we found...
title: Emergency Funding for Ebola Response: Some USAID Reimbursements Did Not Comply with Legislative Requirements and Need to Be Reversed
